attributes.action: not use the Whip when voting on the Lisbon Treaty
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The Prime Minister has responded to the e-petition calling for a referendum on the EU reform treaty and refused to give it. In his response he has said 
"The Treaty is now being debated and scrutinised, with Parliament having the final say on the legislation needed for its ratification. As with all Treaties, Parliament must be satisfied that it is in the national interest, before it can be implemented in national law."
If this is truly the case can the Prime Minister ensure that MP's make there own minds up on the said treaty rather than being coerced by their Whip?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
